word: He who has crushed down all desire for self-recognition will most surely be recognized by the unselfishness of his actions. In order to help and encourage others, he is willing to put aside his own wishes, becoming all things to all men that he may by some means save some. Such a man is a noble leader in Christ's army.--Letter 67, April 26, 1900, to Elder and Mrs. S. N. Haskell, who were engaged in city evangelism.
